Bottle. Dark amber in colour, very nice white head. Aroma of malt, caramel and nice hops (pine mainly). In taste medium sweet, light roastiness, citrus, pine. Medium body, smooth texture, medium bitter and hoppy finish. Nice.

Sampled at Jabeerwocky, pours a clear, dark amber with some creamy, sticky, off white head. Nose is weird though, industrial and soapy, malts, dried fruit, marzipan. Flavor is soapy, a little astringent, some tannic dark tea, raisin too. Tannic finish. Woof.

500ml bottle (?, Poland)
Rich malty aroma, a bit sweet, just smells dark. Deep red, brief head. Full smooth palate, maybe a little heavy. Taste is richly malty, a little savoury. Finish has a nice hoppy bitterness. Maybe a bit too drying. Not showing the alcohol, and remarkably drinkable,

500ml bottle (?, Warszaw). Hazy chestnut color. Small size, bubbly beige head, stays. Sweet, raisins, malty, prunes in aroma. Sweet, roast, toast, raisins, caramel in taste. Soft carbonation. Caramel, sweet and bit yeasty in aftertaste. Feels bit old (BB is 31.07.16). Solid brew.

Bottle (shared by philduk, thanks), bb 31.07.2016. Pours dark copper with beige head. Aroma is sweet, greasy bacon, grass, malt. Flavor is sweet and bitter, malt, caramel, malt. Finish has some dry-roasty bitterness. Covers alcohol well. Overall: ok.

Bottle

Piwo ciemnobrÄ…zowe. Piana bardzo szybko zanika. W aromacie pieczywo, las i cytrusy. Ciekawe poÅ‚Ä…czenie. W smaku niska goryczka nuty karmelowe, palone. Wysycenie Å›rednie. Ciekawy eksperyment.

500 ml. bottle. BBF 31.07.2016. Dark brown faint amber, creamy tanned head. Nose is mellow muted but lovely strong blue cheese hops & cheap but pleasant mocha & low chocolate paste. Very nice for me Â– close to my preferences but not everyoneÂ’s for sure. Taste is delicious creamy chocolate paste (the cheap kind), mocha, easy, creamy but faint metallic (barely there) faintly (of so faintly) lager notes, this is creamy cheap cacao powder & chocolate, surprisingly rich tastes, low dark fruits & for me even more interestingly there is some faint blue cheese hop here, label seems to say that the hop is mosaic (not sure since I donÂ’t know Polish) Â– this is an interesting expression of it. Body is creamy & light. Lovely surprise, easy to drink, cheap chocolate, cacao, low coffee & faint blue cheese, this is great for an easy to drink, almost surprised that this is Dunkler Bock (according to RB at least). This is a really fun, easy & pleasant beer, I would be all over a thicker imperial version of this one. It is funny, I have slammed my fair share of adored Polish beers & now I encounter one with lower than usual ratings & I love it more than others. I do have an usual taste, this is more what the beer scene need right here, more conflicting tastes, more conflicting opinions leading to more varied and interesting beers.

Bottle. Sweet, tropical Mosaic notes combined with a meaty, caramelly maltiness. No bitterness to speak of (too much, that is). Interesting idea but the execution shows that it wasnÂ’t good after all.

Tap at piwoteka. Dark ruby color and small tan head. Aroma of hops, fruity and piny. Taste is light to medium bitter with malty sweetness. Flavor of grapefruit, resin and toasty bread. Aftertaste is long, bitter with resin and roasty flavor.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Butelka, warka do 31.07.2016. ciemy braz z ladna piana. aromaty... Black IPA :) zywice lesne, sosnowe dominuja, do tego nieco owocowosci i w tle dopiero slodowosc kozlakowa, i to moze nawet nie do konca kozlakowa, bo opiekanosc gdzie juz na granicy percepcji. w smaku to sie potwierdza. srednio wysycone, sredni ciala, slodkawe (bardziej niz "tradycyjna" black ipa)... w sumie to mi bardzo pasuje takie cos :) choc zgaduje troche, ze za kazdym tygodniem bedzie sie troche bardziej przenosil ciezar w strone bocka. fajne piwo.Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
